            window.addEventListener('DOMContentLoaded', () => {
              const WCC01 = document.getElementById('sponsor-countdown-ad');

              window.googletag = window.googletag || {};
              window.googletag.cmd = window.googletag.cmd || [];
              window.googletag.cmd.push(() => {
                // WCC01 is on the page, so add an event listener for it
                if (WCC01) {
                  let wcc01CheckIsComplete = false;
                  googletag.pubads().addEventListener('slotRenderEnded', (event) => {
                    if (!wcc01CheckIsComplete && !event.isEmpty) {
                      // we re-declare document.getElementById('sponsor-countdown-ad') instead of using the WCC01 var because the htl ad contents didn't exist when the var was first instantiated
                      if (document.getElementById('sponsor-countdown-ad').contains(document.getElementById(event.slot.getSlotElementId()))) {
                        // trigger the event that the countdown clock is waiting for, to display the ad container
                        document.dispatchEvent(new Event('WCC01_Flighted'));
                        wcc01CheckIsComplete = true;
                      }
                    }
                  });
                }

                // Dispatching event for Gallery AD
                googletag.pubads().addEventListener('slotRenderEnded', (event) => {
                  const PG02 = document.querySelector('#sponsor-gallery_d-t');
                  if (PG02 && PG02.contains(document.getElementById(event.slot.getSlotElementId())) && !event.isEmpty) {
                    document.dispatchEvent(new Event('PG02_Flighted'));
                  }
                });

                // Dispatching event for Recipe AD
                googletag.pubads().addEventListener('slotRenderEnded', (event) => {
                  const WR01 = document.querySelector('#sponsor-recipes');
                  if (WR01 && WR01.contains(document.getElementById(event.slot.getSlotElementId())) && !event.isEmpty) {
                    document.dispatchEvent(new Event('WR01_Flighted'));
                  }
                });

                let hs01CheckIsComplete = false;
                let HS01, HS02;

                const HS01callback = (event) => {
                  if (!hs01CheckIsComplete) {
                    if (HS01?.contains(document.getElementById(event.slot.getSlotElementId()))) {
                      // it's HS01, so check the render state and act on HS02 accordingly
                      const navBN = document.querySelector('.nav-breaking-news');
                      if (!event.isEmpty) {
                        // HS01 rendered, add a class to the breaking news navbar container to ensure a margin above BN bar
                        navBN.classList += ' is-below-shade';
                      } else if (HS02) {
                        // HS01 did NOT render, so remove the  HS02 "blocker"
                        const HS02Parent = document.querySelector('.c-HS02');
                        HS02Parent.setAttribute('class', HS02Parent.getAttribute('class').replace('has-wallpaper', ''));
                      }
                      navBN.classList += ' hs01checkComplete';
                      hs01CheckIsComplete = true;
                      observer.disconnect();
                    }
                  }
                };

                const observeElements = () => {
                  HS01 = document.getElementById('top-half-shade');
                  HS02 = document.getElementById('inline-peekthrough');

                  if (HS01 && HS02) {
                    googletag.pubads().addEventListener('slotRenderEnded', (event) => HS01callback(event));
                  } else if (HS01) {
                    googletag.pubads().addEventListener('slotRenderEnded', (event) => HS01callback(event));
                  } else if (HS02) {
                    const HS02Parent = document.querySelector('.c-HS02');
                    HS02Parent.setAttribute('class', HS02Parent.getAttribute('class').replace('has-wallpaper', ''));
                    observer.disconnect();
                  }
                };

                const observer = new MutationObserver(observeElements);
                const observerConfig = { childList: true, subtree: true };
                observer.observe(document.body, observerConfig);

                observeElements();
              });
            });</script><script type="text/javascript">tp = window.tp || [];
              function toSnakeCase(obj) {
                const newObj = {};
                for (const key in obj) {
                    const snakeKey = key.replace(/([A-Z])/g, "_$1").toLowerCase();
                    newObj[snakeKey] = obj[key];
                }
                return newObj;
              }

              function onCheckoutComplete(data) {
                const params = new URLSearchParams(window.location.search);
                const utmParams = {};

                for (const [key, value] of params) {
                  if (key.startsWith('utm')) {
                    utmParams[key] = value;
                  }
                }

                if (typeof data.chargeAmount !== 'undefined' && data.chargeAmount >= 0) {
                  window.dataLayer.push({ event: 'checkoutSuccess', detailed_event: 'Checkout Success', eventModel: toSnakeCase(data), utm_data: utmParams });
                } else {
                  window.dataLayer.push({ event: 'checkoutSuccessFree', detailed_event: 'Checkout Success Free', eventModel: toSnakeCase(data), utm_data: utmParams });
                }
              }
 
              function onCheckoutClose(event) {
                /* Default behavior is to refresh the page on successful checkout */
                if (event && event.state == "checkoutCompleted") {
                  location.reload();
                }

                if (event && event.state === 'close') {
                  window.dataLayer.push({ event: 'checkoutAbandon', detailed_event: 'Checkout Abandon', eventModel: toSnakeCase(event) });
                }
              }

              /* Callback executed if external checkout has been completed successfully */
              function onExternalCheckoutComplete(event) {
                  /* Default behavior is to refresh the page on successful checkout */
                  location.reload();
              }
              
              const onCompleteUpgradePurchase = (event) => {
                window.dataLayer.push({ event: 'completeUpgradePurchase', detailed_event: 'Purchase upgrade/downgrade', eventModel: toSnakeCase(event) });

                return location.reload();
              };

              // linked term callback handler
              const onLinkedTermSelected = (sessionId, linkedTerm) => {
                const data = linkedTerm.linkedTermData || {};
                const {
                  url,
                  g2i_medium = '',
                  g2i_source = '',
                  g2i_campaign = '',
                  redirect_uri
                } = data.customData || {};

                if (url && redirect_uri) {
                  location.href = url + '&g2i_medium=' + g2i_medium + '&g2i_source=' + g2i_source + '&g2i_campaign' + g2i_campaign + '&redirect_uri=' + redirect_uri;
                } else {
                  console.warn('there was no url or redirect_uri in the linkedTerm data', data);
                }

                // openExternalCheckout(sessionId, externalTermId, amount, currency);
              };

              tp.push(["setAid", 'P3Z2gSespu']);
              tp.push(["setCxenseSiteId", "5858447862403942691"]);
              tp.push(["setComposerHost", 'https://c2.ajc.com']);
              tp.push(["setEndpoint", 'https://vx.ajc.com']);
              tp.push(['setPianoIdUrl', 'https://id.ajc.com']);
              tp.push(["setUseTinypassAccounts", false ]);
              tp.push(["setUsePianoIdUserProvider", true ]);
              tp.push(['setApplePayMerchantId','merchant.com.payway.coxmedia']);

              /* checkout related events */
              tp.push(["addHandler", "checkoutComplete", onCheckoutComplete]);
              tp.push(["addHandler", "checkoutClose", onCheckoutClose]);
              tp.push(["addHandler", "completeUpgradePurchase", onCompleteUpgradePurchase]);

              /* meter related */
              tp.push(["setRequestUserAuthForLinkedTerm", false]);

              /* external checkout related events */
              tp.push(["addHandler", "externalCheckoutComplete", onExternalCheckoutComplete]);
              tp.push(['setLinkedTermSelected', onLinkedTermSelected]);
              // Linked Terms, bypassing Piano ID
              tp.push(['setRequestUserAuthForLinkedTerm', false]);

              // content tagging
              if (typeof initialDataObj !== 'undefined') {
                if (!initialDataObj.contentData.contentTopics){
                  // init tagsArray
                  const tagsArray = [];
                  // Adding tags
                  tagsArray.push(
                      initialDataObj.contentData.contentPaywallStatus,
                      initialDataObj.pageData.pageContentType
                  );
                  // push tags
                  tp.push(['setTags', tagsArray]);
                } else {
                  // init tagsArray and set contentTopics as value
                  const tagsArray = initialDataObj.contentData.contentTopics.split(',');
                  // Adding additional tags
                  tagsArray.push(
                      initialDataObj.contentData.contentPaywallStatus,
                      initialDataObj.pageData.pageContentType
                  );
                  // push tags
                  tp.push(['setTags', tagsArray]);
                }
            }


              

              // script for newsletter signups
              tp.push(['addHandler', 'customEvent', (event) => {
                window.dataLayer.push({ event: 'newsletter_signup', newsletterID: [event.params.prefId] });
                if (event.eventName == 'newsletter-submit-button') {
                  if (tp.pianoId.isUserValid()) {
                    // console.error('dave, newsletter sign up for logged IN user:', event);
                    // logged in user
                    fetch('https://vx.ajc.com/id/api/v1/identity/userinfo?aid=' + tp.aid + '&access_token=' + tp.pianoId.getToken() + '&lang=en_US', {
                      method: 'PUT',
                      headers: {
                        'Content-Type': 'application/json; charset=UTF-8'
                      },
                      body: JSON.stringify({
                        'uid': tp.pianoId.getUser().uid,
                        'form_name': 'NewsletterFields',
                        'custom_field_values': [{
                          field_name: event.params.prefId,
                          value: true
                        }]
                      })
                    });
                  } else if (64) {
                    // console.error('dave, newsletter sign up for logged out user');
                    fetch('https://services.coxnewspapers.com/ajcnewslettersubscribeservice', {
                      method: 'POST',
                      headers: {
                        "Content-Type": "application/json"
                      },
                      body: JSON.stringify({
                        email: event.params.userEmail,
                        prefId: event.params.prefId
                      })
                    })
                  }
                }
              }]);

href="https://www.instagram.com/ajcnews" class="burger-instagram" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"><!--$--><svg width="31" height="31" viewBox="0 0 31 31" fill="none" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"><path d="M8.778.209h12.65c4.819 0 8.734 3.906 8.734 8.713v12.62c0 2.31-.92 4.527-2.558 6.16a8.745 8.745 0 0 1-6.176 2.553H8.778c-4.82 -->.</a></div></div></div></div></div><!--/$--></div></nav></header></div><main class=" b-sectionHome-padding"><header class="b-margin-bottom-d30-m30" data-pagezone="article-body"><div class="c-label-wrapper b-padding-top-15 b-contentMaxWidth"><a class="section-label section-label-link" href="/news/health-news/">Health News</a></div><div class="c-header-gallery-image-video b-margin-bottom-d30-m20"><div class="article-headline-component b-margin-bottom-d30-m30 with-video is-label"><div class="headline"><div class="headline-body"><a class="section-label section-label-link" href="/news/health-news/">Health News</a><h1 class="headline-text headline-text-long">Georgia reports jump in COVID-19 hospitalizations after the holidays</h1></div><div class="subheadline-content"><span>A new variant is reported to be spreading rapidly, but not causing any more severe illness. </span></div></div><!--$--><div class="c-video-component    video-horizontal"><div class="video-component"><div class="powa" data-org="ajc" data-env="prod" data-aspect-ratio="0.5625" data-uuid="DIGWKQCDEKZSYM2UM2B2EWPUXM" data-autoplay="true" data-muted="true" data-playthrough="true" data-discovery="true" data-autoinit="native-hls" data-ads="true" data-controls="true"></div></div><p class="video-credit-text null"></p></div><!--/$--></div></div><div class="c-articleMetaContainer b-contentMaxWidth b-margin-bottom-d30-m20  isSingleColumnArticle"><div class="c-articleMeta"><div class="c-articleBadge"></div><div class="c-articleMetadata"><div class="b-flexRow article-byline b-margin-bottom-d7-m7"><div class="byline "><span>By <!-- -->Helena Oliviero<!-- --> and </span><span><a href="/staff/stephanie-lamm/" rel="author">Stephanie Lamm</a></span></div></div><span class="article-timestamp">Jan 9, 2024</span></div></div><div class="share-bar"><a class="fb-icon" href="https://www.facebook.com/share.php?u=https://ajc.com/news/health-news/following-holidays-georgia-reports-jump-in-covid-19-hospitalizations/VQM5KGS56JFA7BY3PHRG57PAJY/" target="__blank"><svg width="38" height="38" viewBox="0 0 38 38" fill="none" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"><circle cx="19.479" cy="18.765" r="17.871" stroke-width="1.258"></circle><path d="M23.962 10.257v2.74h-1.63c-.595 0-.996.124-1.203.373-.208.249-.312.622-.312 1.12v1.962h3.04l-.404 3.071h-2.636v7.876h-3.175v-7.876h-2.646v-3.071h2.646v-2.263c0-1.286.36-2.284 1.08-2.993.719-.71 1.677-1.064 2.874-1.064 1.017 0 1.805.042 2.366.125z" fill="#1877F2"></path></svg></a><a class="twitter-icon" href="https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=https://ajc.com/news/health-news/following-holidays-georgia-reports-jump-in-covid-19-hospitalizations/VQM5KGS56JFA7BY3PHRG57PAJY/&amp;text=Georgia%20reports%20jump%20in%20COVID-19%20hospitalizations%20after%20the%20holidays" target="__blank"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="38" height="38" viewBox="0 0 38 38" fill="none"><circle cx="18.5" cy="18.5" r="17.871" stroke="#CDCDCD" stroke-width="1.258"></circle><path d="M23.387 11.32h2.608L20.3 17.672 27 26.32h-5.246l-4.108-5.244-4.702 5.244h-2.608l6.091-6.796L10 11.319h5.38l3.713 4.793 4.294-4.793zm-.913 13.477h1.445l-9.326-12.035h-1.549l9.43 12.035z" fill="#222"></path></svg></a><a class="copy-icon" href="#" data-target="" tabindex="0" title="Click here to copy the link for this update to your clipboard."><svg width="38" height="38" viewBox="0 0 38 38" fill="none" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"><circle cx="19.479" cy="18.765" r="17.871" stroke-width="1.258"></circle><path d="M19.78 23.28a.99.99 0 0 1 0 1.401l-.49.49a4.947 4.947 0 0 1-6.995-6.996l1.987-1.987a4.945 4.945 0 0 1 6.786-.204.99.99 0 0 1 .082 1.4.99.99 0 0 1-1.4.083 2.967 2.967 0 0 0-4.07.121l-1.986 1.985a2.967 2.967 0 0 0 4.197 4.197l.49-.49a.992.992 0 0 1 1.399 0zm6.105-11.703a4.953 4.953 0 0 0-6.995 0l-.49.49a.99.99 0 1 0 1.401 1.4l.49-.49a2.968 2.968 0 1 1 4.197 4.198L22.5 19.163a2.967 2.967 0 0 1-4.07.117.994.994 0 0 0-1.318 1.484 4.945 4.945 0 0 0 6.783-.2l1.988-1.987a4.952 4.952 0 0 0 .003-6.999v-.001z" fill="#212126"></path></svg></a></div></div></header><article class="c-articleContent "><div class="c-articleBodyContainer isSingleColumnArticle is-deferred"><span data-pagezone="article-body"><div class="c-section b-sectionHome-padding
        full-width b-clear-both
        b-margin-bottom-d40-m20
        "><div class="c-contentElements" data-start-index="0"><p class="story-text " data-index="1">The number of new COVID-19 hospitalizations in Georgia is surging after the holidays, reaching levels not seen in nearly a year. The state also recorded the highest percentage jump in hospitalizations in the nation.</p><p class="story-text " data-index="2">Georgia reported a 73% increase in new COVID hospitalizations for the week ending Dec. 30 — a far higher jump than the 20% increase nationally for the same week. Georgia’s hospitalizations rose from 538 the previous week to 933, according to the latest data from the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, and more than half those hospitalized were 60 or older.</p><div class="MP02 arc_ad b-margin-bottom-d30-m20 "></div><div class="RP01 arc_ad b-margin-bottom-d30-m20 "></div><section class="c-interstitialLink b-margin-bottom-d40-m20"><span class="prefix">Explore</span><a class="headline" href="https://www.ajc.com/news/health-news/the-latest-flu-numbers-in-georgia-prove-it-more-and-more-of-us-are-sick/XIIIAHC6XJDVDHCWSGEQVCL3UU/" target="_self">The latest flu numbers in Georgia prove it: More and more of us are sick</a></section><p class="story-text " data-index="6">So far, this latest COVID rise seems less deadly than last year’s and much less than the spike in early 2022 when the omicron variant first appeared.</p></div><div class="story-paygate_placeholder"><div class="c-contentElements" data-start-index="6"><div class="lazyload-wrapper "><div class="lazyload-placeholder"></div></div><p class="story-text " data-index="8">At the same time, other nasty bugs are circulating. Flu cases are widespread and soaring around the state.</p><p class="story-text " data-index="9">“We are certainly seeing a spike in our numbers,” said Dr. Marybeth Sexton, an epidemiologist at Emory Clinic about the rise in both flu and COVID cases. “We just need to see what happens, whether this calms down as we get farther from the travel people did over the past couple of weeks. Whether we are at a peak or whether we are going to see this perpetuated, I think this will depend on the safety precautions people take.”</p><p class="story-subscription__placeholder subscription-promo b-margin-bottom-d40-m20"></p><section class="c-interstitialLink b-margin-bottom-d40-m20"><span class="prefix">Explore</span><a class="headline" href="https://www.ajc.com/news/health-news/is-it-the-flu-or-covid-does-it-matter-5-questions-about-winter-viruses/GOXWNN4WAZASRNGBCPPOKMTS2Q/" target="_self">Is it the flu or COVID? Does it matter? 5 questions about winter viruses</a></section><p class="story-text " data-index="12">Older adults and those with weakened immune systems are the most vulnerable to severe illness and complications from COVID. In Georgia, 70% of new COVID hospitalizations during the week that ended Dec. 30 were in those 60 and older.</p><div class="story-nativo_placeholder--moap b-clear-both "></div><p class="story-text " data-index="14">The COVID virus is constantly changing and a new variant has been spreading rapidly around the nation. The variant, known as JN.1, is a descendent of omicron. It now represents 62% of COVID cases in the U.S. according to the most recent surveillance from the CDC. It makes up about the same share in the eight-state Southeastern region that includes Georgia.</p><section class="c-interstitialLink b-margin-bottom-d40-m20"><span class="prefix">Explore</span><a class="headline" href="https://www.ajc.com/news/health-news/more-hospitals-are-requiring-masks-as-flu-and-covid-19-cases-surge/6Q4PDEBEKZFGVAOI6ZNQ66SNCU/" target="_self">More hospitals are requiring masks as flu and COVID-19 cases surge </a></section><p class="story-text " data-index="16">According to the CDC. <a href="https://www.cdc.gov/respiratory-viruses/whats-new/SARS-CoV-2-variant-JN.1.html" target="_blank">the continued growth of JN.1 suggests the variant is either more transmissible or better at evading our immune systems</a>. However, there is no evidence JN.1 causes more severe illness. Early lab data indicates that the updated vaccines are still effective against it and continuing to provide protection against severe illnesses. The CDC also said they expect the antiviral Paxlovid to continue to be effective against this variant.</p><p class="story-text " data-index="17">Compared to the first two winters of the pandemic, the state and nation are in a much better place. Fewer people are dying or becoming seriously ill because vaccines and prior infections have bolstered immunity and reduced the severity of illnesses. At least 96% of adults in the U.S. have either been infected by COVID, providing natural immunity, or have been vaccinated. Many fall into both categories.</p><div class="lazyload-wrapper "><div class="lazyload-placeholder"></div></div><p class="story-text " data-index="19">Omicron variants also don’t seem to invade the lungs as much as other coronavirus variants.</p><div class="MP03 arc_ad b-margin-bottom-d30-m20 "></div><div class="RP09 arc_ad b-margin-bottom-d30-m20 "></div><p class="story-text " data-index="22">Among his patients, Dr. Andrew Reisman, a Gainesville doctor and former president of the Medical Association of Georgia, sees far fewer patients seriously sick compared to the earlier days of the pandemic. In a text, he told The Atlanta Journal-Constitution that encouraging early testing and access to medications to help treat COVID is going a long way in helping his patients “tolerate it better.”</p><p class="story-text " data-index="23">But COVID remains a threat, especially for those who are older and immunocompromised. Immunity wanes over time. Anyone infected can suffer from long COVID, with sometimes debilitating symptoms that linger for weeks, months or even longer.</p><div class="lazyload-wrapper "><div class="lazyload-placeholder"></div></div><p class="story-text " data-index="25">The latest preliminary data on weekly COVID deaths in Georgia show 12 COVID deaths for the week ending Dec. 30. Data from early December, which is considered more reliable, shows around 20 COVID deaths a week in Georgia.</p><p class="story-text " data-index="26">Physicians continue to urge everyone, including those not at high risk of severe illness, to get vaccines against COVID and the flu, and to stay home if they become ill.</p><div class="PX01 arc_ad b-margin-bottom-d30-m20 "></div><p class="story-text " data-index="28">Sexton said it is “certainly reasonable” for anyone to consider wearing a mask in public during this wave of illness, and she would “strongly recommend” masking for those who are high risk, or have someone in their household who is.</p></div></div></div></span><span data-pagezone="post-article-body"><div class="c-section full-width b-clear-both"></div><div class="c-section full-width b-clear-both"><div class="c-blogAuthor b-margin-bottom-30 multiple-authors"><p class="blogAuthor-title">About the Author<!-- -->s</p><div class="blog-author-content"><div was an experience that Curtisha Johnson of Atlanta saw first hand. She was diagnosed with fibroids in 2008, after noticing a growth on the right side of her pelvis. She saw three doctors before finding a fourth who offered her a myomectomy — a surgery to remove fibroids from the uterine muscle while leaving the uterus intact. Her first three doctors insisted she needed a hysterectomy, or the removal of the entire uterus, including the fibroids. She said they dismissed her concerns about the procedure."},{"_id":"TKD64THHZFCR7CZBY5NAYJH7XQ","additional_properties":{"inline_comments":[],"comments":[],"_id":1735601109519},"type":"text","content":"“I had to utilize strategic self-care strategies — to ask, ‘What is it I need, and how can I find that support system?’” she said."},{"_id":"CJYFPSVRMFFHBOVYPTDXLZNDQI","additional_properties":{"inline_comments":[],"comments":[],"_id":1736273154397},"type":"text","content":"Fibroids are tumors that grow in the uterus, or womb, and are typically noncancerous but can be painful. But those people can just be warmed up. What’s really concerning is when they’ve stopped shivering, are breathing slowly, and just feel cold and are confused or have lost consciousness."},{"_id":"AYYWRYCHFZGVPMUPH57QT4SG5Q","additional_properties":{"inline_comments":[{"pos":89,"comment":"just "}],"comments":[],"_id":1736446831887},"type":"text","content":"To fight hypothermia in the stage when someone is just shivering and conscious, they can be brought inside and given dry warm<b> </b>clothes. If they’re losing consciousness or unconscious, that’s an emergency call."},{"_id":"I2FY37JAXBHH5E5GB4565F7SNE","additional_properties":{"inline_comments":[],"comments":[],"_id":1736446831888},"type":"text","content":"Alcohol can be a factor because not only does it numb the mind, but it opens blood vessels wider so they have a harder time keeping the body warm."},{"_id":"NGN7OIINNZHGHINI3CRH3QC37M","additional_properties":{"inline_comments":[{"pos":0,"comment":"People "}],"comments":[],"_id":1736446831889},"type":"text","content":"Those especially at Prevention."},{"_id":"2QVFM3EBNNERNEGDRW3JENRYAQ","additional_properties":{"inline_comments":[],"comments":[],"_id":1735923222069},"type":"text","content":"Alcohol sold in the U.S. contains labels warning of the <a href=\"https://www.ecfr.gov/current/title-27/chapter-I/subchapter-A/part-16/subpart-C/section-16.21\" target=\"_blank\">risks</a> of drinking while pregnant or driving. The surgeon general proposes adding cancer risks to the text, much as already occurs on packages of cigarettes."},{"_id":"LE4H6XHPUZEMDK3PA63LLWMIUM","additional_properties":{"inline_comments":[],"comments":[],"_id":1735926689303},"type":"text","content":"But for this change to take place, Congress would have to pass a new law or amend the Alcoholic Beverage Labeling Act of 1988."},{"_id":"RPKUYTMAMRBWNIZBSSK5BS2WQE","additional_properties":{"inline_comments":[],"comments":[],"_id":1735923222071},"type":"text","content":"In addition to the labeling recommendation, the surgeon general wants to see public health professionals and community groups emphasize that cutting alcohol consumption can reduce Americans’ risk of cancer."},{"_id":"I2GOWW24KRHYNCHL7SUQPTRFT4","additional_properties":{"inline_comments":[{"pos":203,"comment":","},{"pos":282,"comment":","}],"comments":[],"_id":1735923222072},"type":"text","content":"Drinking alcohol — even in small amounts, just a few times a month — has been shown to increase the risk of developing at least seven types of cancer of the breast, colon, esophagus, liver, mouth, throat and voice box (larynx), the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services (HHS) said in a statement."},{"_id":"ZTFRD7CBEBCGND2CUAGF3JMADI","additional_properties":{"inline_comments":[],"comments":[],"_id":1735923222073},"type":"text","content":"For breast cancer specifically, 16.4% of total cases are attributable to alcohol consumption, HHS said."},{"_id":"FX3SQ5MDTNDSFE5TOEPVOBNASY","additional_properties":{"inline_comments":[],"comments":[],"_id":1735923222074},"type":"text","content":"Every five years, the U.S. government issues its U.S. Dietary Guidelines, which aim to help Americans make healthier eating choices. That isolation can be linked to all kinds of mental health illness and cognitive decline.”"},{"_id":"G7H6D3FUYNDMLLK5ECY4ZBEMWU","additional_properties":{"inline_comments":[],"comments":[],"_id":1733839569457},"type":"text","content":"Loneliness is associated with actual harm to human health: increased risk of <a href=\"https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/27091846/\">stroke</a>, <a href=\"https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/30914351/\">memory loss</a> and cardiovascular disease. <a href=\"https://cdn.atlantaregional.org/wp-content/uploads/policybriefing-isolation-final.pdf\" target=\"_blank\">A report by the Georgia Regional Commission found</a> a connection between loneliness in seniors, high stroke rates and <a href=\"https://atlanta.curbed.com/2019/5/3/18528037/atlanta-worst-cities-commute-public-transit-car\">lack of public transportation</a>, which can limit social interactions. One <a href=\"https://extension.unh.edu/blog/2022/05/prolonged-social-isolation-loneliness-are-equivalent-smoking-15-cigarettes-day\">study</a> asserts that the health impact of loneliness is equivalent to smoking 15 cigarettes a day."},{"_id":"BJPFX3ZRDBGMTFQB24EIAAT6IY","additional_properties":{"comments":[],"_id":"RRAPUE5I7ZAF5DKMOXSMHC5IKY"},"type":"divider"},{"_id":"D46TC3IDJZGLLN5CBZO25OJ62E","additional_properties":{"inline_comments":[],"comments":[],"_id":1733839569458},"type":"text","content":"<b>Dr. Ian K. But until the NIH discovery in December, which allowed them to take a sort of freeze-frame photo of the molecule, the actual way in which LDL accumulated in the body wasn’t completely understood. The findings provide new insights that one day can lead to new types of drugs, said <a href=\"https://irp.nih.gov/pi/alan-remaley\" target=\"_blank\">Dr. Alan Remaley</a>, senior investigator in lipoprotein metabolism at the NIH. “Our findings provide a potential new strategy for increasing the ability of the LDL receptor for binding and removing LDL from the circulation,” Remaley explained."},{"_id":"HFWCREQXYJD2DI55STUYCTFKUU","additional_properties":{"inline_comments":[{"pos":125,"comment":"the "}],"comments":[],"_id":1734549616446},"type":"text","content":"Dr. Aditi Das and Dr. MG Finn, both with Georgia Tech’s School of Chemistry and Biochemistry, explained in an email that the technology represents a revolution in biology and biochemistry because it allows scientists to determine the structures of biological molecules in great detail."},{"_id":"XHYA3CICLVAFBMV4QST7EUY4MM","additional_properties":{"inline_comments":[],"comments":[],"_id":1734645500108},"type":"text","content":"How molecules function is determined by their structures. “When we know their structures, we have a big clue as to how they work, how to fix them if they are defective, or how to stop them if they cause harm. But what I find a little scary is that medicine - traditionally a conservative, evidence-based profession - is adopting AI at the hyper speed of Silicon Valley. These AI tools are being widely adopted in clinics even as doctors are still testing when they’re a good idea, a waste of time or even dangerous."},{"_id":"2GCLD2SOTJFOZGTWST72DWMFU4","additional_properties":{"inline_comments":[],"comments":[],"_id":1735219850835},"type":"text","content":"The harm of generative AI - notorious for “hallucinations” - producing bad information is often difficult to see, but in medicine, the danger is stark. A doctor using AI to draft communications could inadvertently pass along bad advice."},{"_id":"VCAJKI7T3NG37GWVSSEE4XQ7E4","additional_properties":{"inline_comments":[],"comments":[],"_id":1735219850837},"type":"text","content":"Another study found that chatbots can echo doctors’ own biases, such as the racist assumption that Black people can tolerate more pain than White people. Most medical encounters I’ve had in the past decade involve the practitioner spending at least half the time typing at a computer."},{"_id":"3O26AQMMOZD2ZOT7X7TSUUHWGA","additional_properties":{"inline_comments":[],"comments":[],"_id":1735219850861},"type":"text","content":"The goal is more than just improving bedside manner. An unyielding tide of administrative tasks is a leading cause of doctor burnout. Because of electronic records and legal requirements, one study found that for every hour of directly interacting with patients, some doctors spend nearly two extra hours writing reports and doing other desk work."},{"_id":"TOLEWN4ZGVBU7DXAT5TCFAYVJ4","additional_properties":{"inline_comments":[],"comments":[],"_id":1735219850863},"type":"text","content":"Sharp’s software, DAX Copilot from Microsoft’s Nuance, not only transcribes a visit, but also organizes and extracts a summary. “It basically drafts it, and I’ll be doing my own work to make sure it is accurate,” he says."},{"_id":"PQQ25CSTJNARJECCCU2MHAC47I","additional_properties":{"inline_comments":[],"comments":[],"_id":1735219850865},"type":"text","content":"After squashing a technical bug that initially caused the AI to fail, Sharp shows me the final product. “The patient presents for evaluation of a persistent cough,” the document begins."},{"_id":"MVTZAFE2UNDUXILEYJ3SYDFTBU","additional_properties":{"inline_comments":[],"comments":[],"_id":1735219850867},"type":"text","content":"The doctor made one notable edit to the AI draft: correcting its assertion that I had attributed my cough to exposure from my 3-year-old. (I had mentioned it as only one possible source.) Sharp changed the file to say it “may relate.”"},{"_id":"DHXB5EAS7ZAP7PKFIXB2F5KRPM","additional_properties":{"inline_comments":[],"comments":[],"_id":1735219850869},"type":"text","content":"While I’m still in his office, Sharp also demonstrates the patient messaging AI he’s been helping Stanford pilot for a year."},{"_id":"DFTZF27SJRDK7AX3ZX7TV7L4KU","additional_properties":{"inline_comments":[],"comments":[],"_id":1735219850871},"type":"text","content":"Here, too, the need is real. During covid lockdowns, a flood of patients began sending messages to doctors rather than booking appointments, and that hasn’t stopped. The AI is supposed to help doctors churn through responses more efficiently by getting them started with a draft."},{"_id":"7NRXVFCYERGJLDCHAJK6D56QLU","additional_properties":{"inline_comments":[],"comments":[],"_id":1735219850874},"type":"text","content":"But this demo doesn’t go as well. Sharp picks a patient query at random. It reads: “Ate a tomato and my lips are itchy. Any recommendations?”"},{"_id":"MO2U5LSBVBARPBRGNRESPL5VMQ","additional_properties":{"inline_comments":[],"comments":[],"_id":1735219850876},"type":"text","content":"The AI, which uses a version of OpenAI’s GPT-4o, drafts a reply: “I’m sorry to hear about your itchy lips. Sounds like you might be having a mild allergic reaction to the tomato.” The AI recommends avoiding tomatoes, using an oral antihistamine - and using a steroid topical cream."},{"_id":"JKOBC77ZNFEGDDJ3G5NZ2WJFGQ","additional_properties":{"inline_comments":[],"comments":[],"_id":1735219850878},"type":"text","content":"Sharp stares at his screen for a moment. “Clinically, I don’t agree with all the aspects of that answer,” he says."},{"_id":"Z2PPKTMCWBDFJDFTH3BGHDGX6Y","additional_properties":{"inline_comments":[],"comments":[],"_id":1735219850880},"type":"text","content":"“Avoiding tomatoes, I would wholly agree with. On the other hand, topical creams like a mild hydrocortisone on the lips would not be something I would recommend,” Sharp says. “Lips are very thin tissue, so we are very careful about using steroid creams."},{"_id":"JSGPKVE4UZHARJBDLO75NHUIHE","additional_properties":{"inline_comments":[],"comments":[],"_id":1735219850882},"type":"text","content":"“I would just take that part away.”"},{"level":3,"_id":"MSPMZMTGWJB25PG6MFMOHZUPAU","additional_properties":{"inline_comments":[],"comments":[],"_id":1735219850884},"type":"header","content":"Open questions"},{"_id":"MDAJFDLS3ZFRTGOMNWLLQBZLNA","additional_properties":{"inline_comments":[],"comments":[],"_id":1735219850888},"type":"text","content":"How often does AI draft that sort of questionable medical advice?"},{"_id":"QEZEBV5B2BEFHLQYXZTN26PEKE","additional_properties":{"inline_comments":[],"comments":[],"_id":1735219850890},"type":"text","content":"Across campus from Sharp, Stanford medical and data science professor Roxana Daneshjou has been trying to find out by pummeling the software with questions - known as “red teaming.”"},{"_id":"AYIOGIQ3PNDAXKB35INLH3MAHU","additional_properties":{"inline_comments":[],"comments":[],"_id":1735219850892},"type":"text","content":"She opens her laptop to ChatGPT and types in a test patient question. “Dear doctor, I have been breastfeeding and I think I developed mastitis. My breast has been red and painful.” ChatGPT responds: Use hot packs, perform massages and do extra nursing."},{"_id":"XNUYJFF7FBFKPKJS5BY2ZZADXE","additional_properties":{"inline_comments":[],"comments":[],"_id":1735219850894},"type":"text","content":"But that’s wrong, says Daneshjou, who is also a dermatologist. In 2022, the Academy of Breastfeeding Medicine recommended the opposite: cold compresses, abstaining from massages and avoiding overstimulation."},{"_id":"VWUU5UXHQRDYJB6ZQLXFXE2MVM","additional_properties":{"inline_comments":[],"comments":[],"_id":1735219850896},"type":"text","content":"Daneshjou has done this sort of testing on a wider scale, gathering 80 people - a mix of computer scientists and physicians - to pose real medical questions to ChatGPT and rate its answers. “Twenty percent problematic responses is not, to me, good enough for actual daily use in the health care system,” she says."},{"_id":"3OQB4OYXDNBULBH4NIKVXQHVJ4","additional_properties":{"inline_comments":[],"comments":[],"_id":1735219850898},"type":"text","content":"Another study evaluating AI on questions about cancer found that its answers posed a risk of “severe harm” 7 percent of the time."},{"_id":"RJ3SZH7JFVGTNMZRH6K54EBMEE","additional_properties":{"inline_comments":[],"comments":[],"_id":1735219850900},"type":"text","content":"It’s not that chatbots can’t do some impressive things - or keep getting better. The problem is that they’re designed to respond with an “average” answer, says Rachel Draelos, a physician and computer scientist who founded the health tech start-up Cydoc. “But nobody’s an average. What makes medicine really interesting is that every patient is an individual and needs to be treated that way.”"},{"_id":"JJJGGUUJ7RFONM2WNSATKNFIBA","additional_properties":{"inline_comments":[],"comments":[],"_id":1735219850902},"type":"text","content":"Academic studies of Whisper, a transcription software released by ChatGPT maker OpenAI, have found that it is prone to making up text in ways that could lead to a misinterpretation of the speaker. Daneshjou’s research has also highlighted problems with the summarization part of the scribe job, showing how AI can at times include hallucinated details - like, in one example, assuming that a Chinese patient is a computer programmer."},{"_id":"43Z425G3XRHVXPW5UVNPRBVM34","additional_properties":{"inline_comments":[],"comments":[],"_id":1735219850904},"type":"text","content":"Unlike those studies, the AI models used by clinics typically have been fine-tuned for medical use. Epic, the software company, wouldn’t share error rates from its internal tests. “To truly assess the accuracy of AI outputs, testing and validation must be based on local customer data,” says an Epic spokeswoman."},{"_id":"WYCFPJJYVBFVFO3ITI2NWOVTUU","additional_properties":{"inline_comments":[],"comments":[],"_id":1735219850906},"type":"text","content":"Anecdotally, some clinics report that doctors keep most of what the AI transcribes: Sharp says that earlier versions were too verbose and had problems with pronouns but that today it is “highly accurate” and used by two-thirds of the Stanford doctors who have access."},{"_id":"RKN35BPGPBGQHD42UGENBKAIMQ","additional_properties":{"inline_comments":[],"comments":[],"_id":1735219850908},"type":"text","content":"AI scribes seem inevitable to many doctors I spoke with, but whether it actually saves them time is an open question. A study published in November of one of the first academic health systems to use AI scribes found that the tech “did not make clinicians as a group more efficient.” Other reports have suggested it saves 10 or 20 minutes."},{"_id":"SSD3BW5NKVF45D5JNUCUMUGJGE","additional_properties":{"inline_comments":[],"comments":[],"_id":1735219850910},"type":"text","content":"And what about the draft messages? How often does the AI go off the rails? “The basic answer is we don’t know,” says Sharp, noting that Stanford’s studies are ongoing. Doctors have been much slower to adopt messaging, he says, but those who use it report that it helps with burnout and being more compassionate in replies."},{"_id":"GEIWXSODONH6NCM2J6Z5SOBQLI","additional_properties":{"inline_comments":[],"comments":[],"_id":1735219850912},"type":"text","content":"Whether it makes them more efficient is, again, questionable. A study at the University of California, San Diego, found that doctors in their pilot of the AI messaging program spent significantly more time reading, possibly because they were scrutinizing drafts for hallucinations."},{"level":3,"_id":"N5JP7ZGA5BFEPNJS22AHZ35DHM","additional_properties":{"inline_comments":[],"comments":[],"_id":1735219850914},"type":"header","content":"Humans in the loop"},{"_id":"NDZ4QMBFOFDGXD2R7GPOEAU7DY","additional_properties":{"inline_comments":[],"comments":[],"_id":1735219850918},"type":"text","content":"How should you feel if your doctor is using AI? Ultimately, it comes down to how much you trust your doctor."},{"_id":"342U3BPMOBCDNC5O6HOONNILQU","additional_properties":{"inline_comments":[],"comments":[],"_id":1735219850920},"type":"text","content":"“I personally don’t yet have confidence that these tools can substitute for my judgment,” Sharp says. “I am growing in a lot of confidence that these tools can relieve my burden on some of my administrative work.”"},{"_id":"CF6HKJHCJBFWDKT26XMYSN3OIA","additional_properties":{"inline_comments":[],"comments":[],"_id":1735219850922},"type":"text","content":"It works, Sharp says, because he is careful to always check the AI’s work."},{"_id":"3UJMU3QN5NETFETKMNLOU7CFDM","additional_properties":{"inline_comments":[],"comments":[],"_id":1735219850924},"type":"text","content":"But what actually happens to doctors’ judgment when they get AI tools is another open question for researchers."},{"_id":"S3C6CQNKJ5CK5HKYNXVMI74KHE","additional_properties":{"inline_comments":[],"comments":[],"_id":1735219850926},"type":"text","content":"Daneshjou compares it to tourists in Hawaii who drive into the water because their GPS told them to. “We trust our systems so much that sometimes we override what we can see with our own two eyes,” she says."},{"_id":"CN6DFHEXQBHVJAEC4YGCX3EGLA","additional_properties":{"inline_comments":[],"comments":[],"_id":1735219850928},"type":"text","content":"Doctors need to be trained on how AI can be wrong. There’s a particular risk for bias, says Rodman, that we know gets encoded into AI like ChatGPT, which is trained on human language. “What happens when a biased human interacts with a biased AI?,” he says. “Does it make them even more biased? Does it not have as big an effect? We don’t know.”"},{"_id":"H2H34Q74KRENXOIVJ4YGDMYVY4","additional_properties":{"inline_comments":[],"comments":[],"_id":1735219850930},"type":"text","content":"If you’re wary about your doctor’s AI, ask to see the notes or summary of your visit to review it yourself. As for AI-drafted messages from your doctor, some organizations require them to include a disclosure, though Stanford Health Care does not."},{"_id":"6YYHPD5QSZH4ZBJLOPWIKOPN7I","additional_properties":{"inline_comments":[],"comments":[],"_id":1735219850932},"type":"text","content":"The University of California, San Francisco, which rolled out AI scribe software widely earlier this month, is watching how much editing the doctors do of the AI documents over time."},{"_id":"RWGFGNZS2VDL3CTUGL7BXMM6H4","additional_properties":{"inline_comments":[],"comments":[],"_id":1735219850934},"type":"text","content":"“If we see less editing happening, either the technology’s getting better or there’s a risk humans are becoming intellectually reliant on the tool,” says Sara Murray, chief health AI officer at UCSF."},{"_id":"EIBWGSBMEFGPXMPV3TQSFOFS6A","additional_properties":{"inline_comments":[],"comments":[],"_id":1735219850936},"type":"text","content":"Medicine has a tendency to make its point of comparison perfection, but of course, doctors themselves aren’t perfect. “If there are things that we can do to improve efficiency and access and it’s imperfect, but better than the current state, then it likely has some value,” Murray says."},{"_id":"TMO3RJJBIVDUJF2KHRI5CQA5JE","additional_properties":{"inline_comments":[],"comments":[],"_id":1735219850938},"type":"text","content":"While these big academic medical institutions are researching the right kinds of questions and putting up guardrails, smaller institutions and clinics are also rolling out AI at an unprecedented clip."},{"_id":"JROWWNHH6RC43O6NHA7XJJONKA","additional_properties":{"inline_comments":[],"comments":[],"_id":1735219850940},"type":"text","content":"“I recognize the healthcare system is broken. Access to care is a huge issue. Doctors make mistakes. I hope AI can solve that,” Daneshjou says. “But we need to have evidence that AI is going to make things better and not actually break them.”"}],"display_date":"2024-12-26T13:39:16.476Z","credits":{"by":[{"org":"The Washington Post","name":"Geoffrey A. The hospital was destroyed, but no one died. No one was even physically injured by the ordeal."},{"_id":"D4LU273M45GBZGH67B3LKDE3PM","additional_properties":{"inline_comments":[],"comments":[],"_id":1734626226991},"type":"text","content":"Yet, earth scientists, emergency management officials, and others who spoke to KFF Health News describe the narrow escape from Unicoi County Hospital as a cautionary tale. As climate change forces health care leaders and public officials to prepare for severe storms in landlocked parts of the country — where residents haven’t historically paid much attention to hurricane warnings — they must be strategic about both the infrastructure design and the locations selected for new projects, like hospitals."},{"_id":"M6JEIFFZQ5DFJPDLROKT4KNRAU","additional_properties":{"inline_comments":[],"comments":[],"_id":1734626226992},"type":"text","content":"The Biden administration <a href=\"https://www.fema.gov/press-release/20240710/biden-harris-administration-finalizes-rule-increase-resilience-against\">finalized a rule</a> this year designed to make the construction of such projects that receive funding from the Federal Emergency Management Agency more resilient to flooding. But a review by KFF Health News identified about 20 other Tennessee hospitals already built in, or near, flood plains."},{"_id":"ZAKI7BEQTZB7HHIBIXWM4QS63Y","additional_properties":{"inline_comments":[],"comments":[],"_id":1734626226993},"type":"text","content":"Patrick Sheehan, director of the Tennessee Emergency Management Agency, said past weather patterns can lull people into a false sense of security. But, he added, “past is not always prologue. We’re going to experience novel, new ways of having disasters.”"},{"_id":"UX7D3JZN5JGKHFCYQ24AX2FUNI","additional_properties":{"comments":[],"_id":"N5GMJOIYMFFM7OBU7WFAR5VEEU"},"type":"interstitial_link","content":"Valdosta hospital staff, others worked through storm to tend to patients","url":"https://www.ajc.com/news/health-news/valdosta-hospital-others-worked-through-storm-to-tend-to-patients/H7QMVIGMPNCJZGWL22FQ2ANPKQ/"},{"_id":"TTM5CT2YTBANDGDLYPPBXNWOCM","additional_properties":{"inline_comments":[],"comments":[],"_id":1734626226994},"type":"text","content":"Historically, the Southern Appalachian Mountains have been the place “where hurricanes go to die,” said Ryan Thigpen, an earth and environmental sciences professor at the University of Kentucky whose research focuses on flooding in the region. But as the Gulf of Mexico becomes warmer and storms, like Helene, that move northward into the mountains carry more moisture, weather events will become more severe."},{"_id":"HWLK7MJPZBEIDMNBKM6V7F34WE","additional_properties":{"inline_comments":[],"comments":[],"_id":1734626226995},"type":"text","content":"“It’s apocalyptic,” said Thigpen, of the damage in Erwin. “The next storm may come before they are finished recovering from this. And that’s kind of scary.”"},{"_id":"7YE37EDBKVBMLIB2TRHQHZ4RCM","additional_properties":{"inline_comments":[],"comments":[],"_id":1734626226996},"type":"text","content":"<b>Hospitals in Flood Plains</b>"},{"_id":"52O47MGIXFAENAPLL4ZU62X4JE","additional_properties":{"inline_comments":[],"comments":[],"_id":1734626226997},"type":"text","content":"All week, Michelle Matson had been worried about Unicoi County Hospital in the oncoming storm."},{"_id":"XRU64LV5ABDRLEXBPRGONGZIU4","additional_properties":{"inline_comments":[],"comments":[],"_id":1734626226998},"type":"text","content":"As a district coordinator for the Tennessee Emergency Management Agency, Matson works with local officials to plan for worst-case scenarios."},{"_id":"VK5QQ55MXRDGJBC6G6AWPJFY3Q","additional_properties":{"inline_comments":[],"comments":[],"_id":1734626226999},"type":"text","content":"Leading up to Hurricane Helene, she’d been in regular communication with the county’s emergency management director. The hospital’s vulnerability next to the river kept coming up."},{"_id":"J4XCYQWKXRAVJKPNXZ7QNA43WY","additional_properties":{"inline_comments":[],"comments":[],"_id":1734626227000},"type":"text","content":"“That was the only place we were worried about,” Matson said."},{"_id":"BSKFJES6H5AOTM27EPSOVSVBNI","additional_properties":{"inline_comments":[],"comments":[],"_id":1734626227001},"type":"text","content":"But concern over the hospital’s location wasn’t new."},{"_id":"BYVRWBZIFFFSBMKVIQDT5EVOX4","additional_properties":{"inline_comments":[],"comments":[],"_id":1734626227002},"type":"text","content":"In November 2013, Unicoi County Memorial Hospital, which opened in 1953, was acquired by Mountain States Health Alliance on the condition that Mountain States would construct a hospital in Erwin to replace the old one."},{"_id":"E6XDXAAYNZEVZK7JIQ7BD7ZNC4","additional_properties":{"inline_comments":[],"comments":[],"_id":1734626227003},"type":"text","content":"Two years later, Mountain States purchased a 45-acre tract of land next to a bend in the Nolichucky River, just off Interstate 26. A hospital system press release at the time explained that due diligence had been conducted to ensure, among other things, that the hospital building would not be in a flood plain. It also presented the location as desirable because it was near the interstate and the landscape would provide “a healing environment by taking advantage of the natural beauty of Unicoi County, with the river running along the east side of the property.”"},{"_id":"ISCNQAETSREKNNA22XWDGEB4G4","additional_properties":{"inline_comments":[],"comments":[],"_id":1734626227004},"type":"text","content":"Dating back decades, though, flood maps published by FEMA put the entire property in a flood plain. The building itself was in a 500-year flood plain (meaning a 0.2% chance of flooding in any given year), while the only road on and off the property was in a 100-year flood plain (meaning a 1% annual risk)."},{"_id":"MMIGQKZSKFBJ5NKZBFUPZ2J5QU","additional_properties":{"inline_comments":[],"comments":[],"_id":1734626227005},"type":"text","content":"But it wasn’t only FEMA maps that forecast this possibility. In 2001, <a href=\"https://www.nrc.gov/docs/ML0935/ML093561392.pdf\">a report published</a> by Unicoi County marked this land as being in a “flood hazard” area. The report warned of “considerable pressure” to develop flood hazard areas across the county “due to population increase and the need for vacant land.”"},{"_id":"27SUAZHKSJFSFCPIBBGEZYSBBA","additional_properties":{"inline_comments":[],"comments":[],"_id":1734626227006},"type":"text","content":"The same report acknowledged a history of destructive flooding in the county and the risks it faced being situated along “three major streams,” including the Nolichucky River, which flows northward out of the Blue Ridge Mountains of western North Carolina straight through Erwin."},{"_id":"23AO4FCQ6NEF7DDMJAUOJEW7HE","additional_properties":{"inline_comments":[],"comments":[],"_id":1734626227007},"type":"text","content":"“If you start looking at the river’s history, there are a number of these notable flood events, and quite a few in the 20th century. They just did not reach this magnitude,” said Philip Prince, a geologist with Appalachian Landslide Consultants. His <a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/@TheGeoModels\">YouTube videos</a> about mountain flooding during Helene have been viewed hundreds of thousands of times. “People should have been expecting more than they did. But again, we have not seen anything like this.”"},{"_id":"MYTXWAXMRRGPZFAVHD2SZKQ24M","additional_properties":{"inline_comments":[],"comments":[],"_id":1734626227008},"type":"text","content":"Matthew Rice, a former Unicoi County commissioner, served as chair of the Hospital Visioning Committee for the new hospital in 2015. He said some committee members raised questions during the planning process about the location, but he conceded there weren’t many large, flat places to build a hospital in Erwin."},{"_id":"3MRFCJ34CVAHRATDFTJGP7BRAU","additional_properties":{"inline_comments":[],"comments":[],"_id":1734626227009},"type":"text","content":"Amid a wave of rural hospital closures across the United States, Erwin residents celebrated when the new hospital opened in 2018. Eight others across the state were built in moderate- or high-risk flood zones, and a dozen other hospitals are situated just outside them, KFF Health News found."},{"_id":"KIJOX6BCFRDWTKTKGD6WQCA6AY","additional_properties":{"inline_comments":[],"comments":[],"_id":1734626227016},"type":"text","content":"The hospitals at risk span the length of the state, from Memphis on the western edge to Knoxville in the east, and include big-city general hospitals, smaller rural hospitals, and behavioral health facilities."},{"_id":"3XH5QLHDI5E23LAXPR5INJZKHQ","additional_properties":{"inline_comments":[],"comments":[],"_id":1734626227017},"type":"text","content":"Some of the hospitals are decades old. <a href=\"https://drive.google.com/file/d/1yTfTIvXLbaZYKMO3E47WmOODQv2BM0WY/view\">Parkridge East Hospital</a> in Chattanooga, for example, was built in the 1970s inside a high-risk flood zone. The 60-bed mental health facility, which <a href=\"https://www.mauryregional.com/media-center/news-story?news=3483\">opened in 2020</a>, is in a low-risk area, but the main road leading in and out of the hospital lies in a high-risk flood area."},{"_id":"63AMPKOWLNFJHF7CRCL4NPGRNY","additional_properties":{"inline_comments":[],"comments":[],"_id":1734626227019},"type":"text","content":"To identify these hospitals, KFF Health News looked for licensed facilities in or near areas that, according to FEMA, have either a high flood risk (with a 1-in-100 chance of flooding in any given year) or moderate risk (a 1-in-500 chance in any given year)."},{"_id":"RWEFB7I6R5ACNA67A3J63OZMUU","additional_properties":{"inline_comments":[{"pos":0,"comment":"MAP"}],"comments":[],"_id":1734639031105},"type":"text","content":""},{"_id":"OB73LZFIPFF35HDVC2SKR26D6Y","additional_properties":{"comments":[],"_id":"HG4RMVQUHNBQHOMY276SLN2FME"},"type":"raw_html","content":"<iframe title=\"Unicoi County Hospital Was Built in a Flood Plain\" aria-label=\"Locator map\" id=\"datawrapper-chart-DPk2J\" src=\"https://datawrapper.dwcdn.net/DPk2J/2/\" scrolling=\"no\" frameborder=\"0\" style=\"width: 0; Meanwhile, the federal regulation finalized this year to expand areas considered at risk for current and future flooding also sets more stringent building standards for critical infrastructure projects located in 100-year flood plains and funded by federal taxpayers."},{"_id":"RCXG53J5UJHIDGBQ2NFPBCTTWI","additional_properties":{"inline_comments":[],"comments":[],"_id":1734626227022},"type":"text","content":"The rule became effective on Sept. 9, less than three weeks before Hurricane Helene ravaged the Southern Appalachians, but it is unclear whether the incoming Trump administration will preserve it."},{"_id":"ZWADM6E2RJHFBP7K5DH3TMETK4","additional_properties":{"inline_comments":[],"comments":[],"_id":1734626227023},"type":"text","content":"After he took office in 2017, President Donald Trump revoked federal flood protection standards set up under the Obama administration. Two days before the flood in Erwin, a satellite office of the National Weather Service in Morristown, Tennessee, predicted “life-threatening flash flooding” near the Tennessee-North Carolina state line."},{"_id":"TFU5BJEY55BY7GS7Z77IIWNGJM","additional_properties":{"inline_comments":[],"comments":[],"_id":1734626227026},"type":"text","content":"The warnings kept coming. The National Weather Service in upstate South Carolina forecast on Sept. 26, a Thursday, that Helene would amount to one of the region’s most significant weather events “in the modern era.”"},{"_id":"OYJHLQ5U5BHCXL34UPT3543A4E","additional_properties":{"inline_comments":[],"comments":[],"_id":1734626227027},"type":"text","content":"“I don’t think people knew what that meant,” said Prince, the geologist. “We just didn’t have a precedent.”"},{"_id":"74ZG5NLAKVCZFJSADCFYVYOHVQ","additional_properties":{"inline_comments":[],"comments":[],"_id":1734626227028},"type":"text","content":"Ballad Health didn’t anticipate that Unicoi would flood during the storm, Levine said, even though a hazard vulnerability assessment conducted annually for the hospital identifies external flooding as the second-highest risk facing Unicoi County Hospital, behind only a civil disturbance. The same 2024 assessment rated the hospital’s preparedness for a flood as a “3″ or “low,” the worst possible score."},{"_id":"WF4G4B46TZHL3PVTD5CYQBMY6Q","additional_properties":{"inline_comments":[],"comments":[],"_id":1734626227029},"type":"text","content":"But a document outlining the hospital’s emergency alert procedures makes no mention of flood risk. It had rained about 5 inches in Erwin over several days, but that was nothing compared with places in the North Carolina mountains that received more than 20 inches over the same period. Rainfall at those higher altitudes eventually drained into the rivers and streams that ultimately destroyed places like Erwin."},{"_id":"SQKFPXXST5DSVFIP7ZKX22SFQU","additional_properties":{"inline_comments":[],"comments":[],"_id":1734626227037},"type":"text","content":"But residents in Unicoi County had no clue what was coming their way, Thigpen said, because there weren’t river gauges upstream to sound alarms about dangerous water levels."},{"_id":"F6QWZKETSRAGJLJ5ZTM7IZAUHQ","additional_properties":{"inline_comments":[],"comments":[],"_id":1734626227038},"type":"text","content":"“I think that our warning systems are antiquated and broken,” he said. “These people in Erwin have seen floods — and a lot of big floods — and it’s never been anywhere close to this.”"},{"_id":"4LIKHTL5IRBV5H4E7ADMYR6BHE","additional_properties":{"inline_comments":[],"comments":[],"_id":1734626227039},"type":"text","content":"Tennessee state climatologist Andrew Joyner is one of several experts now calling for more river gauges to monitor water levels and a network of weather stations in every county designed to collect live precipitation data."},{"_id":"KU4QUG6VCFE5JPHNX7RAJFA32M","additional_properties":{"inline_comments":[],"comments":[],"_id":1734626227040},"type":"text","content":"Thirty-eight states already operate similar systems, he said, estimating that setting up and staffing weather stations across Tennessee would cost less than $4 million in the first year."},{"_id":"JWMUDCG555G73EMGGG24WYE4Y4","additional_properties":{"inline_comments":[],"comments":[],"_id":1734626227041},"type":"text","content":"But the state has failed to act before. Following a catastrophic flood in Waverly, Tennessee, that killed 20 people and destroyed hundreds of homes and businesses in 2021, the Tennessee General Assembly denied a $200 million request to relocate 14 public schools across the state that had been deemed vulnerable to future flooding."},{"_id":"SXYMNBFX6VAFZJAFP3HIFGJDOY","additional_properties":{"inline_comments":[],"comments":[],"_id":1734626227042},"type":"text","content":"<b>‘Might Not Make It Back’</b>"},{"_id":"QXBGJYKZZRGVBBSHKDKMG3STFA","additional_properties":{"inline_comments":[],"comments":[],"_id":1734626227043},"type":"text","content":"On the morning of the flood, Matson had stood with the county’s emergency management director behind Unicoi County Hospital and watched the rising river. “We both had this, like, sick feeling in our stomach that said we’ve got to evacuate,” she remembered. “I said to him, worse comes to worst, we evacuate, nothing happens. Just blame it on me.”"},{"_id":"2XUBULJFBNBYXAO2W57IFTOLWA","additional_properties":{"inline_comments":[],"comments":[],"_id":1734626227044},"type":"text","content":"They made the call to start moving patients out of the hospital just before 9:45 a.m. Less than 30 minutes later, the river had breached its banks, cutting a new channel in front of the hospital and eliminating access to the only road on or off the property."},{"_id":"5JOE7BMKEFHNLG364U5SCBG3M4","additional_properties":{"inline_comments":[],"comments":[],"_id":1734626227045},"type":"text","content":"When an ambulance evacuation became untenable, the Tennessee Emergency Management Agency called in swift-water teams, specially designed to rescue people in turbulent waters. But the flash flood had become so violent and the river was so full of debris that the boats couldn’t safely carry patients away. Meanwhile, dangerous wind conditions prevented helicopters located to the east or west from immediately flying that morning to rescue everyone by air."},{"_id":"TWDBN63TCRBCZI7YD6KJFBX5FU","additional_properties":{"inline_comments":[],"comments":[],"_id":1734626227046},"type":"text","content":"“To be honest, I really thought we may not make it back” from the rescue mission, Boyd, the flight nurse, said."},{"_id":"FKTGF74CKRHQBJUIXYQYJ3VDJQ","additional_properties":{"inline_comments":[],"comments":[],"_id":1734626227047},"type":"text","content":"When the wind started to die down that afternoon, Virginia State Police deployed two helicopters to rescue patients. Eventually, three Black Hawk helicopters from the Tennessee National Guard assisted in the effort. Pilots were required to make multiple round trips between the hospital and the local high school to evacuate four or five people at a time who had been stranded by the flood. Some patients stranded in boats near the hospital were hoisted into helicopters, while those who were stranded on the roof were either carried onto the aircraft or climbed aboard while the helicopters lightly touched down on their skids."},{"_id":"IVCBW2YCEZBRNBPG333OJIC3B4","additional_properties":{"inline_comments":[],"comments":[],"_id":1734626227048},"type":"text","content":"As the afternoon wore on and the evacuation was nearing its completion, pilot Jeff Bush with the Virginia State Police said he learned that the hospital building was weakening. Unlike other chemicals such as chlorine, bromine doesn’t discolor meat and is far less corrosive to equipment."},{"_id":"3K6ENLX2SBBTPNVX34ECXAZLTE","additional_properties":{"inline_comments":[],"comments":[],"_id":1734980874575},"type":"text","content":"But several bromide derivatives have been identified as health hazards, and many more have been implicated as possible carcinogens, <a href=\"https://www.foodsafetynews.com/2010/02/new-meat-treatment-process-enters-market/#:~:text=coli.,far%20less%20corrosive%20to%20equipment.\" target=\"_blank\">according</a> to Food Safety News. One <a href=\"https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/abs/pii/S0160412014002736\" target=\"_blank\">study</a> found that Americans are exposed to higher amounts of bromine via the food supply than people in Europe and Japan."},{"_id":"F3JQURFU3NCLRCTAZIUQLRW36U","additional_properties":{"inline_comments":[{"pos":42,"comment":"fed "},{"pos":152,"comment":","}],"comments":[],"_id":1734730239527},"type":"text","content":"Moreover, because Sher’s animals are only given organic feed, his entire supply chain is free of glyphosate — a herbicide that has been linked to cancer but is used on home lawns and gardens as well as commercial food crops."},{"_id":"BQ4VRYWTZNC43EBVZBXABUW4SU","additional_properties":{"inline_comments":[{"pos":170,"comment":"fed "}],"comments":[],"_id":1734730239528},"type":"text","content":"Experts are concerned that glyphosate-containing herbicides, like Bayer’s Roundup, ultimately end up in humans who eat grains treated with glyphosate or animals that eat feed crops treated with glyphosate."},{"_id":"3WTLA4JY25BD3EE2IE3UX7CNOU","additional_properties":{"inline_comments":[],"comments":[],"_id":1734730239529},"type":"text","content":"Bayer has paid <a href=\"https://www.reuters.com/legal/bayer-must-pay-78-mln-latest-roundup-cancer-trial-jury-finds-2024-10-10/\">billions to settle lawsuits</a> linking Roundup to cancer. The European Union <a href=\"https://www.nature.com/articles/s43247-023-00951-x\">has sought to limit the use of glyphosate</a>, while allowing it in farming as a means of preserving crop yields. The product is widely used in the U.S., but some farmers and environmentalists <a href=\"https://www.reuters.com/legal/government/farmworkers-environmentalists-urge-epa-pull-approval-glyphosate-2023-12-13/\" target=\"_blank\">want to see it banned</a>."},{"_id":"KXXUU5FX4FEBLHZBSX33PTHV6U","additional_properties":{"inline_comments":[],"comments":[],"_id":1734730239530},"type":"text","content":"Shaun Terry, <a href=\"https://www.ajc.com/things-to-do/food-and-recipes/why-grateful-pastures-farm-is-unique-among-georgia-chicken-farms/PFKP7TGWBFD7ZOGCEJD26WHNSY/\">who raises chickens in Mansfield</a> and sells nearly all of his broilers at the Carter Center’s <a href=\"https://freedomfarmersmkt.com/\" target=\"_blank\">Freedom Farmers Market</a> and <a href=\"https://peachtreeroadfarmersmarket.com/\" target=\"_blank\">Peachtree Road Market</a>, says his customers want more out of their food."},{"_id":"P6LURGQI6JA37GMOU4FIFUBFI4","additional_properties":{"inline_comments":[],"comments":[],"_id":1734730239531},"type":"text","content":"“One of the main reasons people seek out our products is to avoid antibiotics and pesticides,” he said."},{"_id":"JRB552AWA5A67AM5G22Y4OX4RI","additional_properties":{"inline_comments":[{"pos":161,"comment":","}],"comments":[],"_id":1734730239532},"type":"text","content":"When animals raised for food are given antibiotics, the meat can <a href=\"https://www.pbs.org/wgbh/pages/frontline/shows/meat/safe/overview.html\">contain antibiotic residues</a>. This, in turn, is bad for humans because it can have health effects and create antibiotic resistance in bacteria that can also impact human health. Some <a href=\"https://pmc.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/articles/PMC9142037/\">studies</a> have also linked allergies to penicillin with use of antibiotics in livestock. The FDA has established rules around antibiotic use in food animals, but controversy over the practice continues."},{"_id":"KQIQHL4SMNB3FLTR7AMEESY6TE","additional_properties":{"inline_comments":[{"pos":103,"comment":","}],"comments":[],"_id":1734987717131},"type":"text","content":"Some <a href=\"https://www.ycp.edu/news/is-organic-food-really-better-for-you\" target=\"_blank\">studies</a> have shown that there’s little nutritional difference between organic and nonorganic foods and that non-organics have a longer shelf life. Affordability also remains an issue, as organic food prices have <a href=\"https://www.lendingtree.com/debt-consolidation/organic-vs-conventional-study/#:~:text=Organic%20food%20prices%20are%20rising,conventional%20costs%20are%20up%209.9%25.\" target=\"_blank\">risen more quickly</a> than their conventional counterparts."},{"_id":"S42AAM3K5NFJLD53H4NMQ2HBGY","additional_properties":{"inline_comments":[],"comments":[],"_id":1734730239533},"type":"text","content":"Terry said inflation in the U.S. has made his organic poultry comparable in price to broilers found in chain supermarkets. Already, the USDA has funneled more than $1.7 billion into tamping down the bird flu on poultry farms since 2022, which includes reimbursing farmers who’ve had to cull their flocks, and more than $430 million into combating the bird flu on dairy farms. In coming years, the bird flu may cost billions of dollars more in expenses and losses. Dairy industry experts say the virus kills roughly 2 to 5% of infected dairy cows and reduces a herd’s milk production by about 20%."},{"_id":"WIV4M75DSFGS7NMQWLVGWDBKFU","additional_properties":{"inline_comments":[],"comments":[],"_id":1734728721500},"type":"text","content":"Worse, the outbreak poses the threat of a pandemic. By then, the outbreak had spread to eight other states. Farmers often move cattle across great distances, for calving in one place, raising in warm, dry climates, and milking in cooler ones. Analyses of the virus’s genes implied that it spread between cows rather than repeatedly jumping from birds into herds."},{"_id":"OIMJHNJ6PJBY7MGD43VUGDNOZU","additional_properties":{"inline_comments":[],"comments":[],"_id":1734728721514},"type":"text","content":"Milking equipment was a likely source of infection, and there were hints of other possibilities, such as through the air as cows coughed or in droplets on objects, like work boots. Inside <a href=\"https://kffhealthnews.org/news/article/bird-flu-cases-colorado-poultry-workers-virus-spread/\">hot barns</a>, they caught infected birds, gassed them with carbon dioxide, and disposed of the carcasses. During the first years of COVID, lagging government funds for outreach to farmworkers and other historically marginalized groups led to a disproportionate toll of the disease among people of color."},{"_id":"WC5UV74S2JH5LBDF6IEFCUH4R4","additional_properties":{"inline_comments":[],"comments":[],"_id":1734728721540},"type":"text","content":"Kevin Griffis, director of communications at the CDC, said the agency worked with the National Center for Farmworker Health throughout the summer “to reach every farmworker impacted by H5N1.” But Bethany Boggess Alcauter, the center’s director of public health programs, said it didn’t receive a CDC grant for bird flu outreach until October, to the tune of $4 million. Before then, she said, the group had very limited funds for the task. “We are certainly not reaching ‘every farmworker,’” she added."},{"_id":"CQ3NWGSHMNA43GOQTYNG24NCYI","additional_properties":{"inline_comments":[],"comments":[],"_id":1734728721541},"type":"text","content":"Farmworker advocates also pressed the CDC for money to offset workers’ financial concerns about testing, including paying for medical care, sick leave, and the risk of being fired. In a controversial decision, the CDC has advised against offering the ones on hand to farmworkers."},{"_id":"TIS6SHD24FEE5BRMPTZ57R2T3Y","additional_properties":{"inline_comments":[],"comments":[],"_id":1734728721544},"type":"text","content":"“If you want to keep this from becoming a human pandemic, you focus on protecting farmworkers, since that’s the most likely way that this will enter the human population,” said Peg Seminario, an occupational health researcher in Bethesda, Maryland. “The fact that this isn’t happening drives me crazy.”"},{"_id":"D7S6KEXTTFB2ZCCJOXUJHWKVJY","additional_properties":{"inline_comments":[],"comments":[],"_id":1734728721545},"type":"text","content":"Nirav Shah, principal deputy director of the CDC, said the agency aims to keep workers safe. “Widespread awareness does take time,” he said. “And that’s the work we’re committed to doing.”"},{"_id":"DYCKY2LIPJCZFJROIRIPAXUEOA","additional_properties":{"inline_comments":[],"comments":[],"_id":1734728721546},"type":"text","content":"As Trump comes into office in January, farmworkers may be even less protected. Surveillance outside of farms was even patchier than on them, and bird flu tests are hard to get."},{"_id":"MR6DACCZCVADDMB5SEAVVVVBUY","additional_properties":{"inline_comments":[],"comments":[],"_id":1734728721555},"type":"text","content":"Although pandemic experts had identified the CDC’s singular hold on testing for new viruses as <a href=\"https://www.healthaffairs.org/doi/10.1377/hlthaff.2024.00038\">a key explanation</a> for why America was hit so hard by COVID in 2020, the system remained the same. All bird flu tests must go through the CDC, even though commercial and academic diagnostic laboratories have inquired about running tests themselves since April. The CDC and FDA should have tried to help them along months ago, said Ali Khan, a former top CDC official who now leads the University of Nebraska Medical Center College of Public Health."},{"_id":"SYUHN2KRHJG3RIURB74HHCQVGU","additional_properties":{"inline_comments":[],"comments":[],"_id":1734728721556},"type":"text","content":"As winter sets in, the bird flu becomes harder to spot because patient symptoms may be mistaken for the seasonal flu. Flu season also raises a risk that the two flu viruses could swap genes if they infect a person simultaneously. That could form a hybrid bird flu that spreads swiftly through coughs and sneezes."},{"_id":"GYUJIQZV6JAZFLC2NSV6WWXQIQ","additional_properties":{"inline_comments":[],"comments":[],"_id":1734728721557},"type":"text","content":"A sluggish response to emerging outbreaks may simply be a new, unfortunate norm for America, said Bollyky, at the Council on Foreign Relations. If so, the nation has gotten lucky that the bird flu still can’t spread easily between people. Controlling the virus will be much harder and costlier than it would have been when the outbreak was small. But it’s possible."},{"_id":"TL2MPJGIDRG6NCESSBUOPZCSSI","additional_properties":{"inline_comments":[],"comments":[],"_id":1734728721558},"type":"text","content":"Agriculture officials could start testing every silo of bulk milk, in every state, monthly, said Poulsen, the livestock veterinarian. “Not one and done,” he added. If they detect the virus, they’d need to determine the affected farm in time to stop sick cows from spreading infections to the rest of the herd — or at least to other farms. Cows can spread the bird flu before they’re sick, he said, so speed is crucial."},{"_id":"A4N5SESZV5HMHKLEK462WKAGEI","additional_properties":{"inline_comments":[],"comments":[],"_id":1734728721559},"type":"text","content":"Curtailing the virus on farms is the best way to prevent human infections, said Jennifer Nuzzo, director of the Pandemic Center at Brown University, but human surveillance must be stepped up, too. Every clinic serving communities where farmworkers live should have easy access to bird flu tests — and be encouraged to use them. Funds for farmworker outreach must be boosted. And, she added, the CDC should change its position and offer farmworkers bird flu vaccines to protect them and ward off the chance of a hybrid bird flu that spreads quickly."},{"_id":"KS7MP6GEF5FRHL3Z64I3MPY43A","additional_properties":{"inline_comments":[],"comments":[],"_id":1734728721560},"type":"text","content":"The rising number of cases not linked to farms signals a need for more testing in general. t"}],"comments":[],"_id":1733432704958},"type":"text","content":"Traditionally, VADs have been bulky and cumbersome, and they come with serious risks for complications, including infections at the site where the device’s cable exits the <a href=\"http://body.is/\" target=\"_blank\">body.</a> It requires major open-heart surgery to implant the device. The device is implanted inside the heart but has a controller unit and battery pack worn outside the body and connected to the VAD through a small opening in the skin."},{"_id":"AGPANVROOBAMVOW3KAT6PXMOPM","additional_properties":{"inline_comments":[{"pos":37,"comment":"over"},{"pos":57,"comment":"to "}],"comments":[],"_id":1733423249623},"type":"text","content":"Major improvements have been made in recent decades that allow people to live longer with fewer complications, and with a better quality of life compared to earlier versions of the device."},{"_id":"AKZQRNHX35H33JPJOBVFPAHEMY","additional_properties":{"comments":[],"_id":"CEIFYH55LJFKRGW6M2K7C6FOYU"},"type":"interstitial_link","content":"Healthgrades: These are Georgia’s best hospitals for cardiology","url":"https://www.ajc.com/pulse/healthgrades-these-are-georgias-best-hospitals-for-cardiology/ZARQY3H46JHSLHNJHP34VD4PAA/"},{"_id":"J3SMLZ6ZSVFTFBWWVPVHS6RMS4","additional_properties":{"inline_comments":[],"comments":[],"_id":1733423249624},"type":"text","content":"Daneshmand is hopeful the BrioVAD System will mark another major step forward in treatment. It has features designed to reduce complications and will be more comfortable to wear than earlier versions of the device."},{"_id":"HROFJCHTAFDFVA73CAKSNU7DJE","additional_properties":{"inline_comments":[{"pos":64,"comment":"FDA "},{"pos":338,"comment":","}],"comments":[],"_id":1733423249625},"type":"text","content":"After being authorized by the U.S. Food and Drug Administration to begin clinical trials earlier this year, Emory became the first site enrolled in the trial to use the BrioVAD System in a patient. The Clarkston clinic only has volunteer physicians in large part because of this gap, Harjee said."},{"_id":"N53WV7EIIRFEZCFBXTZCDP7KTY","additional_properties":{"comments":[],"_id":"QYPWVKZTG5G4THMML4S222MUVY"},"type":"interstitial_link","content":"Federal data shows a nationwide primary care shortage.
